block.p: Kimille Francine Pisane, the daughter of Lee and Randolph Pisane of Westfield, N.J., was married last evening to David Thomas Taylor, the son of Ann and Thomas Taylor of Whickam, England. Khoren Arisian, the senior leader of the New York Society for Ethical Culture, officiated at the Americas Society in New York.
Mrs. Taylor, 30, is a vice president and manager of the registrar department in the New York office of Christie's, the auction house. She graduated from Providence College.

Kimille Pisane, David Taylor Kimille Francine Pisane, the daughter of Lee and Randolph Pisane of Westfield, N.J., was married last evening to David Thomas Taylor, the son of Ann and Thomas Taylor of Whickam, England. Khoren Arisian, the senior leader of the New York Society for Ethical Culture, officiated at the Americas Society in New York.

Kimille Francine Pisane, the daughter of Lee and Randolph Pisane of Westfield, N.J., was married last evening to David Thomas Taylor, the son of Ann and Thomas Taylor of Whickam, England. Khoren Arisian, the senior leader of the New York Society for Ethical Culture, officiated at the Americas Society in New York.
Mrs. Taylor, 30, is a vice president and manager of the registrar department in the New York office of Christie's, the auction house. She graduated from Providence College.

Mr. Taylor, 36, is an assistant vice president for corporate development in the life insurance unit of the MONY Group, a financial services company in New York. He graduated from the University of North London in England and received an M.B.A. from the University of North Carolina.
